title: Perceived ROI level from digital marketing channels worldwide 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Responses on X-axis for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondant.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0.
Among all the Responses, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant 40.0 in Response Website personalization and lowest value 8.0 in Response Social media (organic).
Response Website personalization and Social media (organic) had the biggest gap of 32.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondant found for Don't use or N/A.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondant on the Y-axis for 9 different Responses for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A that are presented on the X-axis.

Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation had the maximum Share of respondant among all 4 groups, and it was for Medium ROI. The minimum Share of respondant was observed in Response Social media (organic) for Don't use or N/A.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Responses on X-axis for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondant.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0.
Among all the Responses, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant 40.0 in Response Website personalization and lowest value 8.0 in Response Social media (organic).
Response Website personalization and Social media (organic) had the biggest gap of 32.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondant found for Don't use or N/A.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondant on the Y-axis for 9 different Responses for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A that are presented on the X-axis.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0.
In Response Website personalization, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant among all 9 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondant in Response Social media (organic).

The maximum Share of respondant for Don't use or N/A that was found in Response Website personalization was 5.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondant observed in Response Social media (organic).
Out of all 4 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondant was found in case of Highest ROI.

Medium ROI had the maximum Share of respondant out of all 4 groups in Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation followed by Medium ROI in E-mail marketing and marketing automation, and the minimum Share of respondant is found for Don't use or N/A in Social media (organic).

Averaging all 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A, the Response Display advertising including programmatic is the maximum Share of respondant and SEO is the minimum Share of respondant.
